soc.server

Class SOCServerMessageHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • soc.server.SOCServerMessageHandler

  • public class SOCServerMessageHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Server class to dispatch clients' actions and messages received from the InboundMessageQueue not related to game play in specific current games and not handled by SOCGameMessageHandler. This also includes some messages related to game lifecycle like SOCJoinGame and SOCSitDown.

    Before v2.0.00, these methods and fields were part of SOCServer .processCommand(String, Connection) and related methods. So, some may have @since javadoc labels with versions older than 2.0.00.

    Since:
    2.0.00
    Author:
    Jeremy D Monin <jeremy@nand.net>
    See Also:
    SOCGameMessageHandler

    • Method Detail

      • dispatch

        final void dispatch(SOCMessage mes,
                    Connection c)
             throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Process any inbound message which isn't handled by SOCGameMessageHandler: Coming from a client, not for a specific game.

        This method is called from SOCServerMessageDispatcher.dispatch(SOCMessage, Connection). Caller of this method will catch any thrown Exceptions.

        Note: When there is a choice, always use local information over information from the message. For example, use the nickname from the connection to get the player information rather than the player information from the message. This makes it harder to send false messages making players do things they didn't want to do.

        Parameters:
        mes - Message from c. Never null.
        c - Connection (client) sending this message. Never null. Connection.getData() won't be null unless mes implements SOCMessageFromUnauthClient.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if mes is null
        java.lang.Exception - Caller must catch any exceptions thrown because of conditions or bugs in any server methods called from here.

      • handleVERSION

        void handleVERSION(Connection c,
                   SOCVersion mes)
        Handle the "version" message, client's version report. May ask to disconnect, if version is too old. Otherwise send the game list. If we've already sent the game list, send changes based on true version. If they send another VERSION later, with a different version, disconnect the client.

        Along with the game list, the client will need to know the game option info. This is sent when the client asks (after VERSION) for GAMEOPTIONGETINFOS.

        Parameters:
        c - the connection that sent the message
        mes - the message
        Since:
        1.1.00

      • handleCHANNELTEXTMSG

        void handleCHANNELTEXTMSG(Connection c,
                          SOCChannelTextMsg mes)
        Handle text message to a channel, including *KILLCHANNEL* channel debug command.

        Was part of SOCServer.processCommand(..) before v1.2.00. Before v2.0.00 this method was handleTEXTMSG.

        Parameters:
        c - the connection
        mes - the message
        Since:
        1.2.00

      • handleGAMETEXTMSG

        void handleGAMETEXTMSG(Connection c,
                       SOCGameTextMsg gameTextMsgMes)
        Handle game text messages, including debug commands. Was part of SOCServer.processCommand before 1.1.07.

        Some commands are unprivileged and can be run by any client:

        • *ADDTIME*
        • *CHECKTIME*
        • *VERSION*
        • *STATS*
        • *WHO*
        These commands are processed in this method.

        Some admin/debug commands like *BCAST* and *DBSETTINGS* are processed here, by calling processAdminCommand(Connection, SOCGame, String, String).

        Others can be run only by certain users or when certain server flags are set. Those are processed in SOCServer.processDebugCommand(Connection, SOCGame, String, String).

        Parameters:
        c - User sending the text message which may be a debug/admin command
        gameTextMsgMes - Text message/command to process
        Since:
        1.1.07

      • processAdminCommand

        boolean processAdminCommand(Connection c,
                            SOCGame ga,
                            java.lang.String cmdText,
                            java.lang.String cmdTextUC)
        Recognize and process admin commands, runnable if SOCServer.isUserDBUserAdmin(String) or is debug user. Handles the commands listed in SOCServer.ADMIN_USER_COMMANDS_HELP.

        Security: Assumes caller has already checked authorization; does not do so here.

        Parameters:
        c - Client sending the admin command
        ga - Game in which to reply
        cmdText - Command text
        cmdTextUC - For convenience, cmdText.toUpperCase(Locale.US) from caller
        Returns:
        true if cmdText is an admin command and has been handled here, false otherwise
        Since:
        2.3.00

      • processDebugCommand_connStats

        final void processDebugCommand_connStats(Connection c,
                                         SOCGame ga,
                                         boolean skipWinLossBefore2)
        Send connection stats text to a client, appearing in the message pane of a game they're a member of. Handles SOCServer.processDebugCommand_connStats(Connection, SOCGame, boolean); see that method's javadoc for details and parameters.
        Since:
        2.2.00
        See Also:
        processDebugCommand_serverStats(Connection, SOCGame), processDebugCommand_gameStats(Connection, SOCGame, boolean)

      • processDebugCommand_gameStats

        void processDebugCommand_gameStats(Connection c,
                                   SOCGame gameData,
                                   boolean isCheckTime)
        Print time-remaining and other game stats. Includes more detail beyond the end-game stats sent in SOCGameHandler.sendGameStateOVER(SOCGame, Connection).

        Before v1.1.20, this method was processDebugCommand_checktime(..).

        Parameters:
        c - Client requesting the stats
        gameData - Game to print stats; does nothing if null
        isCheckTime - True if called from *CHECKTIME* server command, false for *STATS*. If true, mark text as urgent when sending remaining time before game expires.
        Since:
        1.1.07
        See Also:
        processDebugCommand_connStats(Connection, SOCGame, boolean)

      • getSettingsFormatted

        final java.util.List<java.lang.String> getSettingsFormatted(SOCStringManager strings)
        Build a list of server stats for processDebugCommand_serverStats(Connection, SOCGame).
        Parameters:
        strings - String manager for localization if this is for a client connection, or null to use SOCStringManager.getFallbackServerManagerForClient()
        Returns:
        Formatted list of server stats strings. Always an even number of items, a name and then a value for each setting. A few stats are multi-line lists; each continuation lines is a pair whose "name" is " ".
        Since:
        2.3.00
        See Also:
        SOCDBHelper.getSettingsFormatted(SOCServer)

      • processDebugCommand_serverStats

        final void processDebugCommand_serverStats(Connection c,
                                           SOCGame ga)
        Process the *STATS* unprivileged debug command: Send the client a list of server statistics, and stats for the game and connection they sent the command from. Calls processDebugCommand_gameStats(Connection, SOCGame, boolean).

        Before v2.0.00 this method was part of SOCServer.handleGAMETEXTMSG(..).

        Parameters:
        c - Client sending the *STATS* command
        ga - Game in which the message is sent
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        processDebugCommand_dbSettings(Connection, SOCGame), processDebugCommand_connStats(Connection, SOCGame, boolean)

      • processDebugCommand_loadGame

        void processDebugCommand_loadGame(Connection c,
                                  java.lang.String connGaName,
                                  java.lang.String argsStr)
        Process the *LOADGAME* debug/admin command: Load the named game and have this client join it. Calls SOCServer.createAndJoinReloadedGame(SavedGameModel, Connection, String).
        Parameters:
        c - Client sending the command
        connGaName - Client's current game in which the command was sent, for sending response messages
        argsStr - Args for command (trimmed), or ""
        Since:
        2.3.00

      • processDebugCommand_resumeGame

        void processDebugCommand_resumeGame(Connection c,
                                    SOCGame ga,
                                    java.lang.String argsStr)
        Process the *RESUMEGAME* debug/admin command: Resume the current game, which was recently loaded with *LOADGAME*. Must be in state GameState.LOADING or GameState.LOADING_RESUMING. Calls SOCServer.resumeReloadedGame(Connection, SOCGame).
        Parameters:
        c - Client sending the command, game owner if being called by server after last bot has sat down, or null if owner not available
        ga - Game in which the command was sent
        argsStr - Args for command (trimmed), or ""
        Since:
        2.3.00

      • processDebugCommand_saveGame

        void processDebugCommand_saveGame(Connection c,
                                  SOCGame ga,
                                  java.lang.String argsStr)
        Process the *SAVEGAME* debug/admin command: Save the current game.
        Parameters:
        c - Client sending the command
        ga - Game in which the command was sent
        argsStr - Args for command (trimmed), or ""
        Since:
        2.3.00

      • handleSTARTGAME

        void handleSTARTGAME(Connection c,
                     SOCStartGame mes,
                     int botsOnly_maxBots)
        handle "start game" message. Game state must be NEW_GAME, or this message is ignored. Calls SOCServer.readyGameAskRobotsJoin(SOCGame, boolean[], Connection[], int) to ask some robots to fill empty seats, or begin the game if no robots needed.

        Called when clients have sat at a new game and a client asks to start it, not called during game board reset.

        For robot debugging, a client can start and observe a robots-only game if the SOCServer.PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_TOTAL property != 0 (including < 0).

        Visibility is package-level, not private, so SOCServer can start robot-only games.

        Parameters:
        c - the connection that sent the message
        mes - the message
        botsOnly_maxBots - For bot debugging, maximum number of bots to add to the game, or 0 to fill all empty seats. This parameter is used only when requesting a new robots-only game using the *STARTBOTGAME* debug command; ignored otherwise.
        Since:
        1.0.0
